publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-394 Nick Johnston: Prostate Cancer Screening—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a national prostate cancer screening program across Scotland in order to end "post code rationing" in this area and standardise testing by GP’s. Supported by: Mary Scanlon*, Alex Johnstone*, Mr David Davidson*, Alex Fergusson*, David Mundell*, Mr Murray Tosh*

S1M-394 Nick Johnston: Prostate Cancer Screening—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a national prostate cancer screening program across Scotland in order to end "post code rationing" in this area and standardise testing by GP’s. Supported by: Mary Scanlon, Alex Johnstone, Mr David Davidson, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Brian Monteith*
S1M-394 Prostate Cancer Screening (lodged on 16 December 1999) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Tommy Sheridan*, Ms Margo MacDonald*, David McLetchie*
S1M-394 Prostate Cancer Screening (lodged on 16 December 1999) Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-394 Nick Johnston: Prostate Cancer Screening—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a national prostate cancer screening program across Scotland in order to end "post code rationing" in this area and standardise testing by GPs. Supported by: Mary Scanlon, Alex Johnstone, Mr David Davidson, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Margo MacDonald, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Harding, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Phil Gallie*
S1M-394 Prostate Cancer Screening (lodged on 16 December 1999) Robin Harper*
S1M-394 Prostate Cancer Screening (lodged on 16 December 1999) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Miss Annabel Goldie*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S1M-394 Prostate Cancer Screening (lodged on 16 December 1999) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Michael Russell*
S1M-394 Prostate Cancer Screening (lodged on 16 December 1999) Shona Robison*

S1M-394 Nick Johnston: Prostate Cancer Screening—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a national prostate cancer screening program across Scotland in order to end "post code rationing" in this area and standardise testing by GPs. Supported by: Mary Scanlon, Alex Johnstone, Mr David Davidson, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Margo MacDonald, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Harding, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Phil Gallie, Robin Harper, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Miss Annabel Goldie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Bill Aitken*
S1M-394 Prostate Cancer Screening (lodged on 16 December 1999) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-394 Nick Johnston: Prostate Cancer Screening—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a national prostate cancer screening program across Scotland in order to end "post code rationing" in this area and standardise testing by GPs. Supported by: Mary Scanlon, Alex Johnstone, Mr David Davidson, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Margo MacDonald, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Harding, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Phil Gallie, Robin Harper, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Miss Annabel Goldie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Bill Aitken, Donald Gorrie
S1M-394 Prostate Cancer Screening (lodged on 16 December 1999) Fiona McLeod*
S1M-394 Prostate Cancer Screening (lodged on 16 December 1999) Christine Grahame*

S1M-394 Nick Johnston: Prostate Cancer Screening—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a national prostate cancer screening program across Scotland in order to end "post code rationing" in this area and standardise testing by GPs. Supported by: Mary Scanlon, Alex Johnstone, Mr David Davidson, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Margo MacDonald, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Harding, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Phil Gallie, Robin Harper, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Miss Annabel Goldie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Bill Aitken, Donald Gorrie, Fiona McLeod, Christine Grahame
S1M-394 Prostate Cancer Screening (lodged on 16 December 1999) Mr Duncan Hamilton*

S1M-394 Nick Johnston: Prostate Cancer Screening—That the Parliament calls upon the Scottish Executive to set up a national prostate cancer screening program across Scotland in order to end "post code rationing" in this area and standardise testing by GPs. Supported by: Mary Scanlon, Alex Johnstone, Mr David Davidson, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Murray Tosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Margo MacDonald, David McLetchie, Mr Keith Harding, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Phil Gallie, Robin Harper, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Miss Annabel Goldie, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Michael Russell, Shona Robison, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Bill Aitken, Donald Gorrie, Fiona McLeod, Christine Grahame, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Dr Winnie Ewing, Hugh Henry, Dennis Canavan, Ms Sandra White
